description:
What You'll Do:
• Independently prepare complex global clinical trial proposals (RFPs) following RFP guidelines and directions using either standard CTI formats or sponsor formats within targeted turnaround times; work with CTI Client Managers to gather requirements for project and translates into viable proposals for clients; meet with CTI Operations team as well as CTI partners and third party vendors as needed to gather information for inclusion into proposals; understand and apply the concept of efficiencies and understand how inflation and foreign currency exchange rates impact the budget
• Independently participate in meetings and conference calls with BD personnel, prospects, and clients to discuss proposal requirements and to explain and defend current proposals
• Compile Work Order attachments including Payment Schedules; independently discuss and negotiate Work Order Scopes with clients as well as third party vendors; Contract with clients and third party vendors
• Identify potential out-of-scope (OOS) opportunities and develop proposals and contract addendums to existing contracts for clients and third party vendors
• Capable of consistently developing complex budgets and work orders, including but not limited to rescue studies, multi-part studies, multiple overlapping studies, studies with a long-term follow up (LTFU) component and scope changes involving study duration adjustments, protocol amendments and a reconciliation component
• Perform complex mapping of units, hours by role and costs into sponsor fee grids as necessary

What You'll Bring:
• 6+ years experience in professional services / Finance area developing proposals, managing budgets, negotiating contracts with operational responsibilities
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Finance or other business-related area

About CTI

CTI Clinical Trial and Consulting Services is a global, privately held, full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO) focused on the advancement of treatments for chronically and critically ill patient populations. We assist clinical research throughout the lifecycle of development, from drug concept to commercialization. CTI is headquartered in the Greater Cincinnati, OH region with global operations in collaboration with pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device firms. For more information, visit www.ctifacts.com

Why CTI?
• Advance Your Career – We support career progression through a structured mentoring program and leadership courses that provide the support needed to grow. We also value ongoing education and training through tuition reimbursement and a dedicated training department.
• Join an Award-Winning and Valued Team – We have an award-winning unparalleled culture that can be felt by our employees across 60 countries. We support a work-life balance and the importance of time with family by offering generous health benefits and vacation packages, hybrid work from home opportunities, and paid parental leave. We also encourage care for the world around us through our unique CTI Cares program.
• Make a Lasting Impact – We focus on moving medicine forward by working on treatments for chronically and critically-ill patients, who depend on us to bring life-changing therapies to market.
